txt.en: 'I spoke with the men in the towers and walked the streets of Cliving. It is as cheerless as I remembered it, though now its people have good reason, with the threat of Orcs in the Norcrofts. It has always been a grim place. Perhaps that is Athelward's doing: grief seems to follow him wherever he treads. He has been unlucky, losing wife and children to childbirth and sickness. Perhaps it is reflected in the demeanor of his town.'
What did you do while I rode?
